title: South Africa handed huge Rugby World Cup final boost with Cheslin Kolbe declared fit to play
text:
South Africa have been handed a huge boost ahead of Saturday’s World Cup final against England in Yokohama, with head coach Rassie Erasmus confirming that star winger Cheslin Kolbe will be available for selection. Erasmus said that Kolbe would likely be the only change to South Africa’s 23-man squad from their 19-16 semi-final win over Wales, as he dismissed allegations the Boks played “boring” rugby.

Kolbe has been in scintillating form for South Africa in this tournament. Although he has only scored two tries, the former Sevens player turned Toulouse star has been an effervescent presence on the flank, giving New Zealand’s defenders a torrid time in their opening pool stage game.
